exclusion: The Fibaro Sensor is removed from the network by quickly pressing the B button three times (the button is located in the center of the device).
inclusion:
The Fibaro Sensor is added to the network by quickly pressing the B button three times (the button is located in the center of the device).

Note: Every time when any changes are made to the configuration of TP and TD lines (1-wire), e.g. when DS18B20 sensor(s) is (are) included/excluded, it is necessary to execute the procedure of exclusion and repeated inclusion of the sensor module to the central hub. It should be remembered that the system shall enter into the programming mode only once all the connected sensors have been detected (about 10 s).
label: FGBS001
overview:
The Universal Binary Sensor is a wireless module that makes it possible to improve the functionality of any sensor with a binary output by allowing it to communicate with Z-WAVE.
The module allows for wireless communication between the system and the DS18B20 temperature sensors. The device can service up to two binary sensors and up to four DS18B20 temperature sensors.

parameters.label: IN1 Alarm Cancellation Delay
parameters.overview: Additional delay after an alarm from input IN1 has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the input no. 1 alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.

parameters.label: IN2 Alarm Cancellation Delay
parameters.overview: Additional delay after an alarm from input IN2 has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the input no. 2 alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.

parameters.label: Type of input no. 1
parameters.description: Type of input no. 1, what the input 1 will report if no contact is made

parameters.label: Type of input no. 2
parameters.description: Type of input no. 2, what the input 2 will report if no contact is made

parameters.label: Type of control frame for association group 1
parameters.description: Type of transmitted control frame for association group 1.
parameters.overview: Activated via input IN1. The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

parameters.label: Type of control frame for association group 2
parameters.description: Type of transmitted control frame for association group 2
parameters.overview: Activated via input IN2. The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

parameters.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 1
parameters.description: Value of the parameter specifying the forced levels.
parameters.overview:
Value of the parameter specifying the forced levels of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes 'switch on' / 'open' command to devices from association group no. 1.<BR/>In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified.

Possible parameter settings: (1 – 99) and 255
Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device when using
the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to
the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then
deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will
automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

parameters.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 2
parameters.description: Value of the parameter specifying forced levels.
parameters.overview:
Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming /
opening sun blinds when comes “switch on” / ”open” command to
devices from association group no. 2.
In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified.
Default value: 255
Possible parameter settings:
(1 – 99) and 255
Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device; when using of
the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to
the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then
deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will
automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

parameters.label: Deactivate transmission of frame canceling alarm
parameters.description: Deactivating transmission of the frame cancelling the alarm
parameters.overview:
or the
control frame deactivating the device (Basic). It allows for disabling
the deactivation function or the alarm cancellation function for
devices associated with the appropriate input of the Fibaro Sensor.
Default value: 0, in the case of association group no. 1 and 2 the
information is sent
Possible parameter settings:
0 – in the case of association group no. 1 and 2 the information is
sent
1 – in the case of association group no. 1 the information is sent. In
the case of association group no. 2 the information is not sent.
2 – in the case of association group no. 1 the information is not
sent. In the case of association group no. 2 the information is sent.
NOTE: Information concerning alarm violation or activation
commands for devices from association groups are always
sent.

parameters.label: Interval between readings of temperature sensors
parameters.description: Interval between successive readings of temperature sensors
parameters.overview: from all sensors connected to the device in seconds. Note: taking temperature readings from the sensor does not result in sending a temperature condition report to the central hub.

parameters.label: Interval betw. forcing to send report for temp.
parameters.description: The forced report is sent immediately after ...
parameters.overview:
... the next reading of temperature from the sensor, irrespective of the settings
of parameter no. 12.
Default value: 200 s
Possible parameter settings:
0 – 255 s
0 – deactivating the function
Note: Frequent sending of temperature condition reports is
reasonable when the sensor is located somewhere where can
occure rapid changes of ambient temperature. In other cases
it is recommended to leave the parameter set to the default
value.

parameters.label: Insensitiveness to temperature changes.
parameters.description: This is the maximum acceptable difference between
parameters.overview: the last reported temperature and the current temperature taken from the sensor. If the temperatures differ by the set value or more, then a report with the current temperature value is sent to the device

parameters.label: Transmitting alarm/control frame broadcast mode
parameters.description: Transmitting the alarm or control frame in 'broadcast' mode
parameters.overview:
(i.e. to all devices within range), information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network.<BR/><B>NOTE:</B> If the broadcast mode of information transmission is activated for a given channel, then transmission of
information in “singlecast” mode to devices assigned to the
association group of this channel is deactivated.

options.label: IN1 mode active, Sensor 2 mode inactive
IN1 mode inactive, Sensor 2 mode active
INI and IN2 broadcast mode active

parameters.label: Scene activation
parameters.overview: The device offers the possibility of sending commands compatible with Command class scene activation. Information is sent to devices assigned to association group no. 3.

associations.label: Controller Updates
associations.description: Reports on the condition of the device
